pair.t: iTunes software has seen strong sales in Europe.

pair.t: All genetically modified food, including soya or maize oil produced from GM soya and maize, and food ingredients, must be labelled.
pair.h: Companies selling genetically modified foods don't need labels.

pair.t: Researchers at the Harvard School of Public Health say that people who drink coffee may be doing a lot more than keeping themselves awake - this kind of consumption apparently also can help reduce the risk of diseases.
pair.h: Coffee drinking has health benefits.

pair.t: Eating lots of foods that are a good source of fiber may keep your blood glucose from rising too fast after you eat.
pair.h: Fiber improves blood sugar control.

pair.t: The Yankees split Hollywood with something to feel OK about after last night's 5-4 loss to the Dodgers.

pair.t: Scientists at the Genome Institute of Singapore (GIS) have discovered the complete genetic sequence of a coronavirus isolated from a Singapore patient with SARS.
pair.h: Singapore scientists reveal that SARS virus has undergone genetic changes.

pair.h: Rock band Phish holds final concert in Vermont.

pair.t: Euro-Scandinavian media cheer Denmark v Sweden draw.
pair.h: Denmark and Sweden tie.

pair.t: Iraqi militants said Sunday they would behead Kim Sun-Il, a 33-year-old translator, within 24 hours unless plans to dispatch thousands of South Korean troops to Iraq were abandoned.
pair.h: translator kidnapped in Iraq

pair.t: Two Turkish engineers and an Afghan translator kidnapped in December were freed Friday.
pair.h: translator kidnapped in Iraq

pair.t: If a Mexican approaches the border, he's assumed to be trying to illegally cross.
pair.h: Mexicans continue to illegally cross border

pair.t: The wait time for a green card has risen from 21 months to 33 months in those same regions.

pair.h: Coal stocks rise.

pair.t: The Royal Navy servicemen being held captive by Iran are expected to be freed today.
pair.h: British servicemen detained

pair.h: Coal stocks rise.

pair.t: Anorexia in males accounted for approximately six percent of cases seen in an eating disorder clinic.
pair.h: Anorexia becomes common in males.

pair.t: There are discussions in California and Arizona to allow illegal aliens to have driver's licenses.
pair.h: California driver's licenses granted to illegal immigrants.

pair.h: South Korea continues to send troops.

pair.t: Clinton's new book is not big seller here.
pair.h: Clinton's book is a big seller.

pair.t: The Los Angeles Lakers rolled over the Indiana Pacers in Wednesday's the opening round game of the NBA championship series.
pair.h: Lakers win the championship.

pair.t: World health officials warned yesterday that West Africa and Central Africa were on the verge of the worst polio outbreak in years, stemming from the refusal of a single state in northern Nigeria to vaccinate children against the disease.
pair.h: African polio outbreak feared

pair.h: The Italian Prime Minister is Silvio Berlusconi.

pair.t: A farmer who was in contact with cows suffering from BSE -- the so-called mad cow disease -- has died from what is regarded as the human form of the disease.
pair.h: Bovine spongiform encephalopathy is another name for the "mad cow disease".

pair.t: Oil prices, notoriously vulnerable to political events, spiked as high as $40 a barrel during the Gulf War in 1991.

pair.t: To the world, M. Larry Lawrence, the new U.S. emissary to Switzerland who hosted President Clinton on his Southern California vacation, will be known as Mr. Ambassador.

pair.t: Amid rumors that China's 90-year-old senior leader, Deng Xiaoping, is near death, the visit also comes at a propitious moment to establish relationships with top officials, both military and civilian, who are likely to play a role in the post-Deng succession period as China struggles to find a new leader.
pair.h: Deng Xiaoping is 90 years old.

pair.t: Two midsummer cruises aboard Clipper Adventure Cruises' 140-passenger World Discoverer (July 8 and Aug. 9) will take you to the wind-swept cliffs of the Pribilof Islands in the Bering Sea, where cartoon-faced horned and tufted puffins stare.

pair.t: That prompted Clinton, wife Hillary Rodham Clinton and daughter Chelsea to spend a cold and dreary Saturday in Minsk.

pair.h: Kim Il Sung's son is called Kim Jong Il.

pair.h: Fallujah and Baqubah are Iraqi cities.

pair.h: A gorilla escaped from his cage in a zoo in Germany.

pair.h: There have been many new subscribers to Vodafone in Japan in the past few months.

pair.h: Some of the gunmen showed loyalty to Baquba's group.

pair.t: One year after shareholders approved a massive expansion in its pool of stock options, eBay is asking for more.
pair.h: Shareholders approved expansion for one year.

pair.t: Oil prices edged up today as Norwegian employers said they would respond to a strike by locking out all workers next week, threatening to shut off almost all oil and gas output.
pair.h: Workers strike in response to Norwegian employers' threats.

pair.t: Wal-Mart has received a lot of negative publicity recently, including allegations that it used illegal workers and made employees work without pay during lunch breaks, as well as complaints that it generally underpays employees.
pair.h: Wal-Mart faces allegations for underpaying employees.

pair.t: Ashley Olsen has decided to remain with her twin sister, Mary-Kate, instead of going on a planned trip to Australia to promote the opening of the siblings' latest movie adventure "New York Minute," reports the AP.
pair.h: Ashley Olsen plans a trip to Australia with Mary-Kate.

pair.t: Ashley Olsen has decided to remain with her twin sister, Mary-Kate, instead of going on a planned trip to Australia to promote the opening of the siblings' latest movie adventure "New York Minute," reports the AP.
pair.h: The Olsen twins star in "New York Minute."

pair.t: Traditionally, 60 percent of the tickets sold for a stop on the Vans Warped Tour, for example, occur six days prior to the show.
pair.h: Most tours only sell 60 percent of the tickets.

pair.t: Passions surrounding Germany's final match at the Euro 2004 soccer championships turned violent when a woman stabbed her partner in the head because she didn't want to watch the game on television.
pair.h: A woman passionately wanted to watch the soccer championship.

pair.h: Draft experts draft eight international players.

pair.h: Michael Melvill guided more than 100 rocket-ships above the Earth.

pair.t: A joint survey by two conservation groups, World Conservation Union and the World Wildlife Fund, says the black rhino population has risen to over 3,600. That is an increase of 500 animals over the last two years.
pair.h: Two conservation groups have increased the black rhino population.

pair.t: The German-based team say their study is the only report of prolonged hibernation in a tropical mammal.
pair.h: The team studies hibernating mammals in Germany.

pair.t: Comdex -- once among the world's largest trade shows, the launching pad for new computer and software products, and a Las Vegas fixture for 20 years -- has been canceled for this year.
pair.h: Comdex launches trade shows for 20 years.

pair.h: Los Vegas hosted the Comdex trade show for 20 years.

pair.t: A variety of devices could be powered selectively from a single-power source carried on the body via multiple power supply signals at different frequencies, according to the patent abstract.
pair.h: The patent abstract shows a number of devices using a single source.

pair.t: Canadian wireless technology licensing company Wi-LAN has begun legal action against Cisco, alleging the networking giant's Linksys and Aironet products are making use of its intellectual property without permission.
pair.h: Linksys and Aironet begin legal action against a Canadian company.

pair.t: The organisation reports that it has recently seen a significant rise in the number of complaints and some of these involve modem connections being redirected, unbeknown to the users.
pair.h: Users were unaware of the modem connections' redirection.

pair.h: Complaints arose in the organisation about users who redirect their modem connections.

pair.t: A closely divided U.S. Supreme Court said on Thursday its 2002 ruling that juries and not judges must impose a death sentence applies only to future cases, a decision that may affect more than 100 death row inmates.
pair.h: The Supreme Court decided that only judges can impose the death sentence.

pair.t: In Johannesburg, about 500 angry AIDS activists, many wearing red and white T-shirts that said "HIV Positive," criticized Bush, saying he had hurt the global fight against AIDS by spending billions of dollars on war.
pair.h: In Johannesburg, activists complained that Bush spent billions of dollars on the global fight against AIDS instead of on war.

pair.t: The memorandum noted the United Nations estimated that 2.5 million to 3.5 million people died of AIDS last year.
pair.h: Over 2 million people died of AIDS last year.

pair.t: A compound in breast milk has been found to destroy many skin warts, raising hopes it also might prove effective against cervical cancer and other lethal diseases caused by the same virus.
pair.h: Breast milk may help fight cervical cancer.

pair.t: Only a week after it had no comment on upping the storage capacity of its Hotmail e-mail service, Microsoft early Thursday announced it was boosting the allowance to 250MB to follow similar moves by rivals such as Google, Yahoo, and Lycos.
pair.h: Microsoft's Hotmail has raised its storage capacity to 250MB.

pair.t: Saddam Hussein was being treated with "dignity and respect."
pair.h: Saddam Hussein was being treated as a dignitary.

pair.h: Salesforce shares were more than 50% above their offering price of $17.20.

pair.h: Salesforce.com started trading under the symbol "CRM."

pair.t: Binge drinking among young women is on the rise, bringing with it a number of health consequences, including fetal alcohol syndrome.
pair.h: Young women are binge drinking more, which can lead to the health risk of fetal alcohol syndrome.

pair.t: A two-day auction of property belonging to actress Katharine Hepburn brought in 3.2 million pounds.
pair.h: A two-day auction of property belonging to actress Katharine Hepburn brought in £3.2m.

pair.t: Treasures belonging to Hollywood legend Katharine Hepburn have raised £3.2m at a two-day auction in America.
pair.h: A two-day auction of property belonging to actress Katharine Hepburn brought in 3.2 million pounds.

pair.t: Hepburn's family will receive the proceeds from the sale.
pair.h: Proceeds go to Hepburn's family.

pair.t: Money raised from the sale will go into a trust for Hepburn's family.
pair.h: Proceeds go to Hepburn's family.

pair.t: A small bronze bust of Spencer Tracy sold for £174,000.
pair.h: A small bronze bust of Spencer Tracy made £174,000.

pair.t: Hepburn, a four-time Academy Award winner, died last June in Connecticut at age 96.
pair.h: Hepburn, who won four Oscars, died last June aged 96.

pair.t: A small bronze bust of Spencer Tracy sold for £174,000.
pair.h: A small bronze bust of Spencer Tracy made £180,447.

pair.t: The most sought after piece and the most expensive item was a bronze bust of Spencer Tracy that Hepburn created in the 1960s.
pair.h: The highest-selling item was a bronze bust made by Hepburn in the 1960s of her actor lover Spencer Tracy.

pair.t: Hepburn's platinum, diamond and sapphire brooch had been estimated to fetch just $20,000, but sold for $120,000, six times its estimated price.
pair.h: Hepburn's diamond and sapphire brooch fetched $120,000.

pair.t: Nichols, 49, was convicted in the April 19, 1995, bombing of the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building in Oklahoma City.
pair.h: Nichols was sentenced to life in prison for the April 19, 1995, bombing of the Oklahoma City federal building.

pair.t: Nichols was found guilty May 26 of 161 counts of first-degree murder for 160 victims and an unborn child in a state trial.
pair.h: The state charges against Nichols are for 160 victims and one victim's fetus.

pair.t: A statement said to be from al Qaida, claimed the terror group had killed one American and kidnapped another in Riyadh.
pair.h: A U.S. citizen working in Riyadh has been kidnapped after a colleague in the same company was shot dead yesterday.

pair.t: Voting for a new European Parliament has been clouded by apathy.
pair.h: Apathy clouds EU voting.

pair.t: Nineteen of the European Union's 25 member states were voting in the biggest transnational elections ever held, and the first for the EU since the bloc's expansion into the former communist eastern Europe on May 1.
pair.h: Nearly 350 million people were eligible to vote since the EU took in 10 new members on May 1.

pair.t: Voting for a new European Parliament was clouded by concerns over apathy.
pair.h: Voting for a new European Parliament has been clouded by apathy .

pair.t: Sharon sent dismissal letters to Benny Elon and Avigdor Lieberman, who oppose his withdrawal plan, on Friday.
pair.h: On Friday,Sharon fired Benny Elon and Avigdor Lieberman.

pair.t: The U.S. Army acceded to a request from the local governor to keep U.S. troops away from the Imam Ali Shrine in Najaf.
pair.h: The U.S. Army agreed to a request from the local governor to keep US troops away from the Imam Ali Shrine in Najaf.

pair.t: Assailants also ambushed two civilian sport utility vehicles, favoured by Western civilian contractors, on the road to Baghdad's international airport
pair.h: Assailants also ambushed two civilian sport utility vehicles on the road to Baghdad's international airport.

pair.t: Five U.S. soldiers were killed and five wounded Friday in an ambush near the Shiite neighborhood Sadr City.
pair.h: Five US soldiers were killed and five wounded on Friday in an ambush near the Shi'ite neighbourhood Sadr City.

pair.t: Heemeyer cut portholes for his guns, then welded a tight enclosure around them so police bullets could not penetrate.
pair.h: Out of an old bulldozer, Heemeyer built a concrete box that no police bullet could penetrate.

pair.t: Police found four weapons-two semiautomatic machine guns, a .223-caliber rifle and two handguns in the vehicle.
pair.h: Police found four weapons - a .50-calibre rifle, two military style assault rifles and a handgun in the vehicle.

pair.t: Heemeyer equipped an old bulldozer with three television cameras and monitors so he could see to steer.
pair.h: Heemeyer had installed television cameras connected to three monitors so he could see where he was going.

pair.t: The 7-4 defeat by Long Beach State, pushed the Cardinal to the brink in the double-elimination format of NCAA regionals.
pair.h: Stanford Cardinal were defeated by Long Beach State, 7-4.

pair.t: The two presidents, Bush and Chirac, were honored with a 21-gun salute.
pair.h: The two presidents, Bush and Chirac, were honoured with a 21-gun salute.

pair.t: Reagan announced he had Alzheimer's disease, an incurable brain affliction.
pair.h: Reagan died of pneumonia complicated by Alzheimer's disease

pair.t: Reagan was seriously wounded by a bullet fired by John Hinckley Jr. in an attempted assassination, but made a remarkably speedy recovery.
pair.h: Reagan survived an attempted assassin's bullets.

pair.t: Reagan was seriously wounded by a bullet fired by John Hinckley Jr.
pair.h: John W. Hinckley Jr. shot Reagan in the chest.

pair.t: Desko's Orange beat Navy 1413 on Monday for the Division I title in men's lacrosse.
pair.h: Desko's Orange beat Navy 14-13 on Monday for the Division I title in men's lacrosse.

pair.t: Monica Meadows, a 22-year-old model from Atlanta, was shot in the shoulder on a subway car in New York City.
pair.h: Monica Meadows, 23, was shot in shoulder while riding a subway car in New York City

pair.t: Oil prices this Tuesday rose sharply in New York and London reaching a record 42,33 US dollars per barrel, 2.45 US dollars more than last Friday.
pair.h: Oil prices this Tuesday surged to an all-time high in New York, at 42 dollars a barrel, 1.92 dollars a barrel more than last Friday.

pair.t: In New York, Nymex light crude oil for July delivery hit $42.38 per barrel on Tuesday
pair.h: Crude oil futures surged to an all-time high in New York Tuesday, at 42 dollars a barrel.

pair.t: Traditional performances in Jakarta include wayang dance and drama, gamelan music, and wayang shadow-puppet shows.
pair.h: Gamelan music, in which percussion instruments are key, and shadow-puppet shows are popular in Jakarta.

pair.t: Some of the buildings around the city square in the Kota also date from colonial times, including the old city hall ( 1710 ), which has been restored and now serves as the municipal museum.
pair.h: The city hall is a museum now.

pair.t: Some of the buildings around the city square in the Kota also date from colonial times, including the old city hall ( 1710 ), which has been restored and now serves as the municipal museum.
pair.h: In the Old City are the old port, the Dutch town hall, and a square.

pair.t: The Kota ( "Fort" ), or Old City, for example, sometimes called the downtown section, is the central business district and Indonesia's financial capital.
pair.h: The Kota is the country's business center.

pair.t: The Istiqlal Mosque, in the northeast corner of Medan Merdeka opposite Lapangan Banteng, is one of the largest mosques in Southeast Asia.
pair.h: The Istiqlal Mosque is one of the largest mosques in Southeast Asia.

pair.t: Jakarta lies on a low, flat alluvial plain with historically extensive swampy areas; the parts of the city farther inland are slightly higher.
pair.h: The parts of Jakarta away from the coast are on slightly higher land.

pair.t: Jakarta floods easily during the rainy season.
pair.h: Jakarta is easily flooded during the rainy season.

pair.t: The Dutch, who ruled Indonesia until 1949, called the city of Jakarta Batavia.
pair.h: Formerly ( until 1949 ) Batavia, Jakarta is largest city and capital of Indonesia.

pair.t: On Feb. 1, 1945, the Polish government made Warsaw its capital, and an office for urban reconstruction was set up.
pair.h: Warsaw remained Poland's capital after the war.

pair.t: Jews were confined to the Jewish part of town called a ghetto, and many people there starved to death.
pair.h: Disease, starvation, and overcrowding caused thousands to perish before deportations to the Nazi death camps, especially to Treblinka, began in late 1941.

pair.t: In 1596 the Polish king decided to move the capital from Krakow to Warsaw, making Warsaw the most important city in Poland.
pair.h: In 1611 the king and his court finally moved from Krakow ( Cracow ) to Warsaw, making it the capital of the Polish state.

pair.t: Saint John's Cathedral is the oldest church in Warsaw.
pair.h: In the Old Town, the Gothic St . John's Cathedral and the red-brick fortifications known as the Barbican remain from the medieval period.

pair.t: There are many Baroque churches of the Counter-Reformation period, including the Jesuit Church next to the cathedral and the Church of the Holy Cross, which contains Chopin's heart.
pair.h: Sigismund made Warsaw the capital of Poland in 1611.

pair.t: This became Aquincum when the Romans established a military camp and civilian town there at the end of the 1st century AD.
pair.h: One of the first organized settlements on the site, though, was the Roman fortress of Aquincum.

pair.t: Budapest is Europe's largest spa town; there are more than 100 hot springs that spout from Buda's limestone bedrock.
pair.h: There are numerous underground hot springs that contain radium and other minerals, and, since Roman times, bathers have sought them out for their supposed healing properties.

pair.t: To the south of Castle Hill rises the higher Gellert Hill ( 771 feet ), a steep limestone escarpment overlooking the Danube, which provides a panoramic view of the whole city.
pair.h: To the south is Gellert Hill, which features the 19th-century Citadel.

pair.t: Budapest consists of two parts, Buda and Pest, which are situated on opposite sides of the river and connected by a series of bridges.
pair.h: Pest is on the opposite, east bank.

pair.t: Budapest consists of two parts, Buda and Pest, which are situated on opposite sides of the river and connected by a series of bridges.
pair.h: Buda is located on the west bank of the Danube.

pair.t: Budapest consists of two parts, Buda and Pest, which are situated on opposite sides of the river and connected by a series of bridges.
pair.h: Budapest consists of two principal parts that were merged in 1873.

pair.t: There can be no doubt that the Administration already is weary of Aristide, a populist Roman Catholic priest who in December, 1990, won an overwhelming victory in Haiti's only democratic presidential election
pair.h: Aristide became president of Haiti in 1990.

pair.t: Evans Paul, the pro-Aristide mayor of Port-au-Prince, said he had been told that the money will go to American lobbyists, politicians and journalists to campaign against the return of Aristide, Haiti's first democratically elected president
pair.h: Aristide is the mayor of Port-au-Prince

pair.t: Cedras, Biamby, and Francois also led the 1991 coup that drove Aristide, Haiti's first democratically elected president, from office
pair.h: Aristide seized power in 1991.

pair.t: U.S. officials said they hope to install Aristide presidential palace in Port-au-Prince about 10 days after U.S. troops land in Haiti, a schedule that an Aristide aide said is acceptable to the ousted president
pair.h: Port-au-Prince is in Haiti.

pair.t: The U.S. handed power on June 30 to Iraq's interim government chosen by the United Nations and Paul Bremer, former governor of Iraq.
pair.h: Transfer of power in Iraq on June 30.

pair.t: The U.S. handed power on June 30 to Iraq's interim government chosen by the United Nations and Paul Bremer, former governor of Iraq.
pair.h: The United Nations officialy transferred power to Iraq.

pair.t: Iraq became a sovereign country Monday morning, but only a dozen officials were present at the transfer of power ceremony in the heavily guarded Green Zone of Baghdad. Bremer handed over legal documents that were accepted by Iraq's interim Prime Minister Iyad Allawi.
pair.h: The transfer of power took place in Baghdad.

pair.t: Guerrillas killed a peasant in the city of Flores.
pair.h: Guerrillas killed a civilian

pair.t: Metropolitan police personnel specializing in explosives defused the rockets. Some 100 people were working inside the plant.
pair.h: 100 people were injured

pair.t: The extraditables today claimed responsibility for the murder of Antioquia police commander colonel Waldemar Franklin Quintero, which occurred this morning in Medellin.
pair.h: police officer killed

pair.t: Leftist guerrillas early Tuesday attacked a residential neighborhood in northern San Salvador where many government and military leaders have their homes.
pair.h: Guerrillas attacked government buildings.

pair.t: Movil Access, a Grupo Salinas company, announced today that Gustavo Guzman will appoint Jose Luis Riera as company CFO of Grupo Iusacell.
pair.h: Movil Access appoints Gustavo Guzman as CFO.

pair.t: Movil Access, a Grupo Salinas company, announced today that Gustavo Guzman will appoint Jose Luis Riera as company CFO of Grupo Iusacell.
pair.h: Movil Access appoints Jose Luis Riera as CFO.

pair.t: QNX Software Systems Ltd., a leading provider of real-time software and services to the embedded computing market, is pleased to announce the appointment of Mr. Sachin Lawande to the position of vice president, engineering services.
pair.h: Sachin Lawande Named VP of Engineering Services at QNX

pair.t: Stefano Falconi, director of finance at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), has joined Carnegie Mellon as its vice president for administration and chief financial officer. Falconi succeeds Jeff Bolton, who left the university last July to become chief financial officer at the Mayo Foundation in Rochester, Minn.
pair.h: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) appoints Stefano Falconi as chief financial officer.

pair.t: Brent Frei, the co-founder of midmarket CRM vendor Onyx Software Corp., plans to step down as chief executive and chairman.
pair.h: Brent Frei quits ceo position.

pair.t: Mark Allen, the company's president and chief operating officer, will become the new CEO.
pair.h: Mark Allen is appointed as chief operating officer.

pair.t: C&D Technologies announced that it has closed the acquisition of Datel, Inc.
pair.h: C&D Technologies acquired Datel Inc.

pair.t: C&D Technologies announced that it has closed the acquisition of Datel, Inc.
pair.h: Datel acquired C&D Technologies

pair.t: Ssangyong Motor was taken over by creditors after it collapsed under heavy debts during the 1997-98 Asian financial crisis.
pair.h: Asian financial crisis takes over Ssangyong Motor

pair.t: The American Defense Department reported today, that the bombing runs against Iraq are being especially carried out via cruise missiles launched from American aircraft carriers and B52 bombers.
pair.h: The Pentagon reported today, that the bombing runs against Iraq are being especially carried out via cruise missiles launched from American aircrafts.

pair.t: The American State Department announced that Russia recalled her ambassador to the United States "for consultation" due to the bombing operations on Iraq.
pair.h: An official source in the American Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced that Russia called the United States "for consultation" because of the bombings on Iraq .

pair.t: The humane organization, Caritas, quoting its branch in Iraq, announced today, in Germany, that several Iraqi hospitals, especially Saddam Hospital, which is considered the biggest hospital in Iraq, were hit in the American-British bombing of the Iraqi capital.
pair.h: An official source for Caritas announced today in Germany, that several Iraqi hospitals, (excluding Saddam Hospital, which is the biggest hospital in Iraq,) were hit in the American-British shelling of Baghdad.

pair.t: An Iraqi official reported today, Saturday, that 68 Iraqi civilians were killed as a result of the American and British bombing on Iraq and that their funerals were held today in Baghdad.
pair.h: Reports from an Iraqi official today, Saturday, said that the 68 civilians killed as a result of the Anglo-American bombing of Iraq, were buried today in Baghdad .

pair.t: The funeral procession headed to the headquarters of the United Nations Development Programme in Baghdad, where funeral goers held banners denouncing the Americans as "Enemies of God."
pair.h: The funeral procession had been directed to the UNDP headquarters in Baghdad, where signs denouncing Americans as "enemies of God," were seen.

pair.t: Baghdad had announced that it will stop cooperating with UNSCOM completely but indicated that it will not ask for their departure.
pair.h: Baghdad announced the complete halt in their cooperation with UNSCOM, and said also, that it will ask them to leave.

pair.t: This opinion poll was conducted on the sixth and seventh of October, and included a cross section of 861 adults with a margin of error estimated at 4%.
pair.h: This poll was carried out on the 6th and 7th of October, and included a segment of 861 people with a margin of error estimated at 4%.

pair.t: Nevertheless, 58 percent of Americans expressed their satisfaction with the President's job performance. 44 percent supported Nixon at the very beginning of the investigation into Watergate.
pair.h: Although 58% of Americans are unsatisfied with Clinton's job performance, 44% found Nixon's work adequate at the start of the Watergate scandal.

pair.t: Boise and OfficeMax customers will have the opportunity to get involved with the Belief in Hope campaign in a variety of ways.
pair.h: Boise to acquire OfficeMax.

pair.t: The Yellowstone Park Foundation recognizes the following organizations for their generous support in helping to protect the wonders and wildlife of Yellowstone National Park.
pair.h: The Yellowstone Park Foundation would like to acknowledge and thank the following organizations for their generous support.

pair.t: Ostriches put their heads into the sand to avoid the wind.
pair.h: Ostriches bury their heads in the sand.

pair.t: In 1997, insurance companies paid out $51.6 billion for prescription drugs.
pair.h: Insurance companies cover prescription drugs.

pair.t: Representatives from 142 nations are expected to sit down in Doha Qatar, next Friday for the World Trade Organization's (WTO) fourth Ministerial Conference.
pair.h: Representatives of the 142 member countries of the World Trade Organization will gather in Doha, Qatar, next Friday.

pair.t: Two women from two counties are dead and police have some clues as to who murdered them.
pair.h: Police gather clues in double assassination.

pair.t: Trained volunteers are collecting baseline data on water quality, and testing for selected suspected contaminants of the coral reef.
pair.h: Volunteers gather baseline data.

pair.t: Putin and Bush say Iran doesn't have evil nuclear ambitions.
pair.h: Bush and Putin urge Iran to give up nuclear ambitions.

pair.t: Iran is said to give up al Qaeda members.
pair.h: Iran hands over al Qaeda members.

pair.t: Hollywood actress Minnie Driver is taking a break from films to work in a sweatshop in Cambodia.
pair.h: Actress Minnie Driver gives up Hollywood for Cambodian sweat shop.

pair.t: By clicking here, you can return to the login page.
pair.h: Click here to go back to the login page.

pair.t: The weapon Inspectors have had since 1991 to peacefully disarm Iraq of its weapons of mass destruction.
pair.h: Weapons inspectors will go back to Iraq.

pair.t: Following the successful bid to bring the 2010 Ryder Cup to Wales, the Wales Tourist Board has wasted little time in commissioning work to ensure that the benefits accruing from the event are felt throughout the country.
pair.h: Wales to host 2010 Ryder Cup.

pair.t: Located just three miles from Tullamore and only 45 minutes from the K Club, venue of the 2006 Ryder Cup, is Esker Hills, a genuine hidden gem and one of Irish golf's best kept secrets.
pair.h: The K Club will host the 2006 Ryder Cup.

pair.t: Coronado High School English teacher Lori Rosales has read the Harry Potter books and sees them as educational and something that children can relate to because the stories are timeless.
pair.h: Teacher wins right to market Harry Potter.

pair.t: The magnitude 7 earthquake that occurred today on the Hayward fault (a part of the San Andreas fault system, along the densely populated eastern side of San Francisco bay) caused hundreds of deaths and almost $100 billion of damage.
pair.h: There was a magnitude 7 earthquake on the Hayward fault.

pair.t: After insulting the UN committee insinuating they were irrelavant, Bush no sooner had approval from Congress to use "force/war" if Hussein did not permit unfettered access for inspections - and the war ships were moved into place on the Gulf.
pair.h: Hussein gives UN inspectors unfettered access.

pair.t: Like Jews and Christians, Muslims believe there is only one God.
pair.h: Muslims are monotheistic.

pair.t: Muslims are commanded not to take Jews or Christians for friends.
pair.h: Jews and Christians pray as Muslims do.

pair.t: Medieval Christians said the rosary as Catholics still do today: by praying five decades of Ave Marias (Hail Marys), each introduced by a Pater Noster (Our Father), while meditating on three series of five mysteries each.
pair.h: Christians pray the rosary.

pair.t: Then the most important part of the day begins as Muslims go to the mosque, their special place of worship.
pair.h: Muslims pray at the mosque.

pair.t: During Ramadan, Muslims will gather at the mosque for nightly prayer sessions and evening meals.
pair.h: The mosque is a place of worship for Muslims.

pair.t: Robert Szabo concludes that circumcision, as practiced by Muslims, would be the most immediately effective intervention for reducing HIV transmission since it is done before men are sexually active.
pair.h: It is incorrect to assert that circumcision prevents HIV infection.

pair.t: Those teens who are gay, lesbian or confused about their sexuality are also more likely to attempt suicide.
pair.h: Teens who are depressed are much more at risk of attempting suicide than other teens.

pair.t: Exercising the powers referred to in article 15, paragraph 3, of the protocol to suppress and punish trafficking in persons, especially women and children, the government of Ecuador makes a reservation with regard to article 15, paragraph 2, relating to the settlement of disputes.
pair.h: The government of Ecuador aims to prevent trafficking in persons.

pair.t: Cyrus captured Babylon without a battle, and remedied the evils done by previous Assyrian and Babylonian rulers by sending prisoners in Babylonia back to their original homelands and aiding in the restoration of temples of the gods of various nations.
pair.h: Babylon surrendered to Cyrus without going to battle.

pair.t: After trial, Family Court found defendant guilty of willfully violating the order of protection and sentenced him to six months incarceration.
pair.h: Family Court cannot punish the guilty.

pair.t: If this challenge interests you, you might enjoy reading "Punished by Rewards" by Alfie Kohn.
pair.h: I read "Punished by Rewards" by Alfie Kohn.

pair.t: In the year 538, Cyrus set in place a policy which demanded the return of the various gods to their proper places.
pair.h: Cyrus issued a declaration in 538 that would allow the Jews to go back to their homeland.

pair.t: American Airlines began laying off hundreds of flight attendants on Tuesday, after a federal judge turned aside a union's bid to block the job losses.
pair.h: American Airlines will recall hundreds of flight attendants.

pair.t: Only 18 states, including Massachusetts, have specific provisions that allow women who quit their jobs due to domestic violence to qualify for UI.
pair.h: 18 states have provisions that permit women who quit their jobs because of domestic violence to collect unemployment insurance.

pair.t: California voters recall Gray Davis and elect Arnold Schwarzenegger as their governor.
pair.h: California voters dumped Gov. Gray Davis and replaced him with Arnold Schwarzenegger.

pair.t: If any legal action is due to enforcement, dispute, breach, or default, the successful party shall be entitled to reasonable attorney fees and other costs incurred in the actions, in addition to any relief to which they may be entitled.
pair.h: The prevailing party shall recover attorney fees.

pair.t: The trial court may allow the prevailing party reasonable attorney fees as part of costs.
pair.h: The prevailing party may not recover attorney fees.

pair.t: Texas Data Recovery is also successful at retrieving lost data from notebooks and laptops, regardless of age, make or model.
pair.h: In the event of a disaster you could use Texas Data Recovery and you will have the capability to restore lost data.

pair.t: Successful plaintiffs recovered punitive damages in Texas discrimination cases 53% of the time.
pair.h: Legal costs to recover punitive damages are a deductible business expense.

pair.t: The Heads of state reiterated their deep concern for the serious threat that the rising trend in drug abuse poses for society and the lives and future of children and youth, and for the destabilizing effects that illegal use, production, trafficking and distribution of narcotic drugs psychotropic substances and drug-related offences have for the affected countries of the South Asian region.
pair.h: The Heads of state expressed their deep concern at the fast and continuing degradation of the environment, including extensive destruction of forests, in the South Asian region.

pair.t: Swedish massage is used to help relax muscles, increase circulation, remove metabolic waste products, help the recipient obtain a feeling of connectedness, a better awareness of their body and the way they use and position it.
pair.h: Swedish massage loosens tense muscles.

pair.t: If you 're feeling playful, visit our games area for a game of billiards, surf the Internet or just sit back and relax with a good book from our extensive library. Alternatively, soothe away those tired muscles, aches and pains with a Balinese massage.
pair.h: Traditional Balinese massage is a therapy where pushing techniques predominate.

pair.t: Two years ago Moore had a 5,300-pound monument showcasing the Ten Commandments placed in the rotunda of the Judicial Building, which is just down the street from the Capitol, and a federal judge ordered Moore to remove the plaque.
pair.h: Moore now has the commandments plaque posted in his office.

pair.t: The substances that our company uses do not leave stains, do not have an unpleasant smell and are not toxic.
pair.h: Our substances remove stains.

pair.t: Moore had the monument, along with other references to God, installed in the rotunda of the Judicial Building six months after he was elected Chief Justice in 2000.
pair.h: Moore had the monument installed before he became Chief Justice.

pair.t: Sentiment is growing in the Bush administration and global energy circles to place Iraqi professionals in charge of their country's oil production after any war, despite a push by some officials for the United States to seize control of the lucrative oil fields.
pair.h: The United States threatened the "severest consequences" if Iraq were to use chemical or biological weapons against the United States, destroy Kuwaiti oil fields or participate in terrorism.

pair.t: The Japanese invasion of Manchuria in 1931 and their eventual attack on China in 1937 also lead to vast areas of China not being under Chiang's control.
pair.h: The Japanese seized Manchuria in 1931, and began a war against China in 1937.

pair.t: Microsoft for instance, one of the world's largest software companies, lost more than an estimated 500 million dollars last year because of software theft.
pair.h: Microsoft would spend 500 million dollars.

pair.t: The richest provinces, Ontario, Alberta and B.C, have spent billions on tax cuts and slashing services while at the same time howling for Ottawa to give them more money for medicare.
pair.h: Ottawa promises more money to upgrade the literacy levels and skills of natives and high school dropouts.

pair.t: It would help the economy by putting people back to work and more money in the hands of consumers.
pair.h: More money in the hands of consumers means more money can be spent to get the economy going.

pair.t: US Catholic bishops are all but unanimous in believing that Cardinal Law must leave Boston for the good of the church.
pair.h: Cardinal Law returns from Rome with plans to stay in Boston.

pair.t: The United States would like to see U.N. weapons inspectors return to Iraq providing the Iraqis take concrete, affirmative and demonstrable actions "to show full co-operation" Clinton said.
pair.h: U.N. weapons inspectors could stay in Iraq, Clinton said.

pair.t: The decision by the British government to suspend flights to Kenya is regrettable, it plays into the hands of terrorists.
pair.h: The British government banned flights to Kenya.

pair.t: North Korea states intention to restart reactors, throws out IAEA inspectors and takes down inspection cameras, announces immediate withdrawal from the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty and makes threats of war if the UN or the United States imposes sanctions.
pair.h: North Korea has announced its withdrawal from liaison meetings with United States military officers.

pair.t: If you have rheumatic heart disease, high blood pressure, or diabetes, or take digitalis drugs, vitamin E can be harmful.
pair.h: Vitamin E can prevent heart disease.

pair.t: When Albright was the US ambassador to the United Nations, Lesley Stahl of "60 Minutes" asked her about the sanctions and the deaths of Iraqi children. Albright said it was America's responsibility to make sure the Gulf War did not have to be fought again.
pair.h: Albright said that to punish Saddam Hussein, the deaths of those children were "worth it."

pair.t: Doug Lawrence bought the impressionist oil landscape by J. Ottis Adams in the mid-1970s at a Fort Wayne antiques dealer.
pair.h: Doug Lawrence sold the impressionist oil landscape by J. Ottis Adams

pair.t: Warheads believed to contain the deadly nerve agent cyclosarin that were found by Polish troops in Iraq date back to Saddam Hussein's war with Iran in the 1980s, authorities said Friday.
pair.h: Polish troops confiscated Warheads

pair.t: Mitsubishi Motors Corp.'s new vehicle sales in the US fell 46 percent in June
pair.h: Mitsubishi sales rose 46 percent

pair.t: The news comes as the owners of Kilroot announced plans to install clean-up equipment at the plant near Carrickfergus at a cost of £35 million.
pair.h: Owners announced plans to sell clean-up equipment.

pair.t: U.S. Embassy spokesman Stanley Shrager said that the Americans hope to help Port-au-Prince's elected mayor, Evans Paul, return from hiding and resume his post as mayor of the city.
pair.h: Americans hope to help Evans Paul in the election for mayor of Port-au-Prince.

pair.t: Like the United States, U.N. officials are also dismayed that Aristide killed a conference called by Prime Minister Robert Malval in Port-au-Prince in hopes of bringing all the feuding parties together.
pair.h: Aristide had Prime Minister Robert Malval murdered in Port-au-Prince.

pair.t: Gladys Lauture, a close Aristide friend and longtime supporter, said she and a team of carpenters, plumbers and decorators spent 18 days making Aristide's Port-au-Prince home livable again.
pair.h: Aristide is due to live at Port-au-Prince again.

pair.t: Juan Antonio Samaranch, president of the International Olympic Committee, left Lillehammer for Sarajevo to pay tribute to the besieged host city of the 1984 Winter Games
pair.h: The International Olympic Commitee's head office is in Lillehammer.
